alert.note: Alert for Greater Lake Tahoe Area (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 26 at 2:15PM PST until December 28 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM TUESDAY TO 10 AM PST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 10 inches, except 1 to 2 feet above 7000 feet. Wind gusts around 50 mph with gusts up to 100 mph along the Sierra ridgetops. Waves 3 to 5 feet on Lake Tahoe. * WHERE...Greater Lake Tahoe Area. * WHEN...From 10 AM Tuesday to 10 AM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Strong winds could cause extensive tree damage. Small vessels may capsize. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Very strong to damaging winds will precede the winter storm warning. Furthermore, there is relatively high uncertainty to snow levels during the main moisture push Tuesday morning. Overall, 6 to 15 inches of heavy/wet snow is possible above 7500 feet before snow levels fall Tuesday afternoon.
info.instruction: Avoid travel if possible, you could be stuck in your vehicle for hours. If you must travel, prepare for long delays and carry an emergency kit with extra food, water and clothing. If you stay home, have a backup plan in case of power outages. Avoid boating on area lakes until winds and waves subside. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
